alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:39PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Rio Blanco County through 815 PM MDT... At 739 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meeker, or 33 miles southwest of Craig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Rio Blanco County, including the following locations... Axial. This includes Colorado 13 between mile markers 45 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Flat Tops
